byline.original: By AL BAKER and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum and Alain Delaquérière contributed reporting.

abstract: Unsealed indictments against 16 New York City police officers facing charges for ticket-fixing reveal how process worked; all officers have pleaded not guilty.
snippet: The counts are a result of a long-running grand jury investigation into ticket-fixing at the New York Police Department.
lead_paragraph: The counts are a result of a long-running grand jury investigation into ticket-fixing at the New York Police Department.

headline.main: Unsealed Indictments Shed Light on Procedures for Ticket-Fixing by Officers
headline.print_headline: Unsealed Indictments Shed Light on Procedures for Ticket-Fixing by Officers
headline.seo: Indictments Reveal Police Procedures for Ticket-Fixing
